metadata.Title: CVE-2016-6207 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the _gdContributionsAlloc function in gd_interpolation.c in GD Graphics Library (aka libgd) before 2.2.3 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (out-of-bounds memory write or memory consumption) via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6207` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.3
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> php uses the system libgd2

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.3').
